Reviews.Title: “Steinhart is a classic property with great service”
Reviews.Author: philfna
Reviews.Content: The Steinhart is not a modern or sleek hotel, but a comfortable hotel with great rooms that make you feel like you are at home. Dimitar the manager, Nicole, and all the staff genuinely care for you and your needs. They are super to work with, and make sure you know you're being looked after. I like the security of the building and the comforts afforded by it -- we would have stayed here longer, but needed a bigger space for our cats. Again Steinhart is a really wonderful hotel great for kids, families, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dean T
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed her last september (Apoligies for the review being a little late). It was great, well decorated spacious appartments. They have everything in there you require, you could quite easily live in one of them. The price was reasonable aswell, I cant remember exactly what it cost, but it was the same as an average-low priced hotel room in San Francisco. Location is good, seemed a bit rough in some areas nearby, but only a ten minute walk to the city centre and 15 minutes down to the pier. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderfull!!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Storm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks, in a large apartment on the top floor.......with a large living room, dining room, 1 bed room and a good sized kitchen. And everything was just great. We recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Classy, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: One of the best all around lodging experiences I have ever had. We stayed here for five nights and we could easily have stayed a month. The Steinhart balances apartment-style living with hotel convenience at a very affordable rate. Our suite of rooms at the back of this venerable building on the 4th floor was quiet, stylish, and spotlessly clean. We had four large rooms, including full kitchen, dining room, living room and bath. This all for about $200. per night. Although the hotel does not have a cafe, room service or other conventional amenities, the immediate neighborhood offers these services in abundance. Turn right and there's a well stocked market; turn left and find Cup a Joe, a wonderful urban coffee shop/cafe. The location boasts easy access to tourist enclaves like Union Square and authentic residential settings like Pacific Heights, or you can trek through the panhandlers of the Tenderloin to SOMA. Rent a car around the corner at Hertz for $40.00 per day, all in. The kitchen had everything we needed although we mercifully ate most meals out. Wireless was free and though the two large flat screens are not high def, they have tons of offerings. The wire cage elevator is fun and there are two set of stairs that anchor the wide, pleasant central hallway. Maid service is once a week, but the suite was well stocked and we'd rather have the privacy.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Steinhart helped make my trip to SF unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Elliot W
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a studio apartment at the Steinhart for a week in December, based on solid reviews on this site. Not only was I not disappointed in my choice, but my expectation were exceeded far greater than I could have even asked for. If you read some of the other reviews here you will notice the resident manager Dimitar's name all over the place. The reason for this is the guy is exceptional. Upon arrival there weren't any studio rooms available, so he instantly upgraded me without flinching. He was full of information about San Francisco and was not only pleasant to deal with, but gave all the time needed. Nothing was a stress for this guy and there were no pressures at all in my stay. Obviously the room is one of the most important things, and the room I stayed in was a one bedroom apartment. The room was clean and spacious, with a large comfortable bed. There was a small TV in the bedroom and a large flatscreen in the lounge. The room had a full kitchen, complete with stove, oven, microwave and fridge. The bathroom was spacious also, with plenty of full length mirrors. Upon arriving in my room I unpacked all of my clothes into the closet and drawers, as this place really felt like a small apartment one might live in. I really felt at home here and it was such a shame to leave. One thing that people need to realise before they decide on making their booking is what type of building they want to stay at. If you are after a hotel with doormen, room service and the like this place is not for you. The Steinhart is a gorgeous apartment complex that provides a stay in a great part of San Francisco in a contemporary apartment. The elevator is classic old school and the lobby is beautiful. There are laundry facilities downstairs should you wish to use them. This place is the perfect place to stay if you're looking to go about your business at your own convenience and don't require all of the minor things that hotels do. I noticed that on my trip I stayed at hotels, but lived at the Steinhart. This was such a big difference. The location is another thing that this place has going for them. They're located in a quiet street, only 8 minutes walk from Union Square. One can easily walk to Union Square and bypass the Tenderloin completely (which is 2-3 blocks away). SF has a big homeless problem, but thankfully there weren't any homeless people around where I was staying. The Steinhart still has double security doors with keycodes (which they give you upon arrival) to add that extra layer of security. Across the street is a great coffee shop if you want to grab a morning coffee and bagel. Three doors down is a grocery store, which is perfect to stock up the full kitchen. Next door to the grocery store is Aces bar, which is open until late 7 days and plays all major sporting games. My stay in San Francisco was one of the greatest experiences of my life because of the comfort, location and friendly staff at the Steinhart. I'm already clamoring to head back to SF and there is no doubt in my mind I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Apartment Hotel full of Character !”
Reviews.Author: Champagne4everyone
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here earlier this year and the place is quirky and spunky. The décor is different in each apartment as they are privately owned but our apartment (1 bedroom) was sensational. Has everything you need and is full of early 1900 character. The Manager Dimitar is seriously awesome, the best service we received in America, although all the service we received in America was fantastic ! Highly recommend this hotel, it is close to everything and has great cooling/heating. For those Gay and Lesbian travellers... it is quite close to the Castro (5 minute taxi ride) and Dimitar just great and makes you feel right at home...stay there...I'll guarantee you will love it !

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: maat35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Steinhart late September 2011. The manager Dimitar was the best! He gave us an upgrade to the two bedroom apartment because they had overbooked us. Nothing but great comfort and loads of room. The patio at the back of the house is really nice too. Plenty of small supermarkets nearby (expensive) and okay restaurants within walking distance. If I were to return to San Francisco for a week I would most definitely want to stay at the Steinhart again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kennedyromo
Reviews.Content: /We enjoyed this Hotel, the room was nice "but" my only issue was the bed! I was told it would be a Queeen ,but turned out to be a Double. The Hotel was booked, so could not move us to another room. The staff were very friendly, trying to make our stay comfortable. It is located apporx. 5 long blocks from Union Square, but once you figure out the buses, it was fine. We would stay there again, if I was guaranteed a Queen Bed.

Reviews.Title: “A delight to come "home" to”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Steinhart for the first time in late Sept/early Oct '11. What a lovely hotel. If you plan on being in San Francisco for a week or more, this is the place to be. I can't think of a negative comment to offer. The neighborhood is friendly (as long as you don't stray south into the Tenderloin and which you're warned not to do on checking in), the hotel is architecturally stunning; the elevator is a wonderful treat; the rooms are huge, comfy, well furnished, and well supplied; the lobby looks totally relaxing (although our room was so great we never spent any time there); and best of all, the people at the front desk are just the nicest folks you'll ever want to meet. You're three (uphill) blocks from the California St cable cars (and three downhill blocks on the way home), five blocks from Powell Street, an easy walk to Union Square, and there are nearby bus lines that will get you where you want to go and that run frequently. There is no daily housekeeping service (no big surprise if you read anything about the hotel before you book) but there is a dishwasher in the kitchen (or at least in ours), a laundry room in the basement, and a laundromat next door. You have a full kitchen, a dining room, and plenty of space to relax after a day of work or sightseeing. This being San Francisco, there was plenty of street noise at night, but nothing compared to the hotels we've stayed in closer to Union Square.By far the nicest hotel in which I've had the pleasure to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, inviting, homey”
Reviews.Author: Kittyg77
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Steinhart. What a beautiful hotel and the room was fantastic! Very warm and inviting, it was a great place to come "home" to at the end of a busy sightseeing day. The location is great, it is close to bus and cable car stations; and it is central enough to be able to walk to many great places like Union Square, The Financial District, and the Ferry Building. There is a fantastic sandwich nook a few doors up the street. I slept on a cot, while the rest of my family slept on the beds and it was so comfortable, I did not miss a moment's sleep. Our room was very spacious as well. We couldn't hear people the suite above, below or beside us, which was lovely. The staff were helpful and very friendly. I would stay here again in heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart at the Steinhart in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: This is the most incredible hotel I've every stayed at, and I've stayed in plenty. I travelled to San Francisco with my 3 sisters and a brother-in-law and we stayed in a Premier Suite. There was plenty of room and privacy for all of us. We had a full size kitchen, with full size appliances. We had a dining room, a living room with a couch, chair and murphy bed, a bedroom and plenty of closet space. The staff were all super friendly and ready & willing to help in any way they could. The decor and atmosphere are untouchable. Don't let the location scare you! Although the Tenderloin is close it is easily avoidable with a map and little research, which anyone travelling should do when going to a city they don't know. We did not at any time feel uncomfortable walking about the city but we did avoid the Tenderloin. Again, with a little research on bus routes and the incredible deal you get from MUNI for a bus pass, we were able to navigate the city with little effort. From the airport take BART to downtown (Market & Powell), purchase your bus pass from a kiosk next to the Powell Street cable car turnaround, walk half a block to Syril Magnin and hop on the 27 bus to Sutter and walk half a block to hotel. We did not upgrade the internet but then we were here for a music festival (Hardly Strictly Bluegrass...thank you Warren Hellman) and to explore the city, so only needed the internet for Google and e-mail. We will be back for Hardly Strictly Bluegrass and you can bet your bottom dollar that we will be staying at the Steinhart when we return! Magnifico!

Reviews.Title: “Steinhart NOT for the faint of heart!”
Reviews.Author: 244Traveler
Reviews.Content: Beware the Steinhart! If you are expecting a HOTEL, it isn't. It is a RESIDENTIAL hotel meaning that there are no amenities. It is nothing like the picture shown on Tripadvisor. It is on the edge of one of the roughest neighborhoods in SF. Parking is in private garages and the one recommended by the hotel is usually full and always staffed by aggressively rude young men. The hotel wifi is miserable. The bright spot is the hotel staff who are universally friendly and helpful. Stay here if you want to experience SF Noir. Go elsewhere for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie H
Reviews.Content: When my husband and me moved to San Francisco we spent the first 3 weeks in the Steinhart. We had a wonderful time there. It's a charming hotel with friendly staff. Especially Dimitar, the GM, was very helpful. Whenever you have a question or need advice, just ask him. Our apartment on the 6th floor came with a well equipped kitchen, a spacious living and bed room and a full bath. It was bright and cosy. We didn't feel like in a hotel there at all. It really felt like home. The proximity to the Tenderloin, that was mentioned in some of the other reviews, didn't really bother us. During the day we haven't experienced the Tenderloin as dangerous. Nonetheless we tried to avoid the area at night, which is easy because the Tenderloin isn't very big. So, not a big deal at all. All in all: fantastic hotel, great location and excellent service. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel reflecting the city's history.”
Reviews.Author: Bankermom95
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a week at the Steinhart. Everything was wonderful - from the front desk staff to the location. Rooms are well apportioned and beautiful - reflecting the city's Victorian history. Just a few blocks away from the Powell and Mason/Hyde cable cars. While others have commented re: proximity to the Tenderloin, it was not an issue and front desk staff was very good at showing us where not to go. If you are staying for a longer vacation and the idea of having a bit more space and a kitchen appeals to you, this is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great aparthotel, slightly dodgy location”
Reviews.Author: Filmbird
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly recommend the Steinhart, you get great value for money in what is a pretty expensive city. It’s clean, spacious, quiet, secure, free internet and really helpful manager. I stayed in a one-bedroom apartment with separate kitchen and living room, perfect for a 10 day work trip. It also has a real feeling of history unlike the cookie cuter Marriott style rooms that pervade the city. No view from the window other than an internal courtyard and wall, which can make it quite dark, but on the plus side that made it quiet. Yes it’s a tiny bit scuffed round the edges but that contributes to its charm. The only down side is the location. Don’t get me wrong, in terms of access to Union Square it is great, a couple of blocks from Macys, the Powell-Mason Streetcar, walking distance of Chinatown (albeit up hill). It’s just it’s in an area affectionately know as the Tendernob, at the base of Nob Hill and bordering the Tenderloin. I should have known it was not the safest of areas when the brilliant manager gave me a map and drew a big red ring around the place “I was never to go to”. Luckily I did not have that much trouble as I got cabs everywhere, but I was hassled by a couple of drunks walking back from dinner on Sunday evening. So advice for travelers, stay here if you want space and charm, just don’t wander around the area late at night, especially alone.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home. Wonderful for a short or long stay.”
Reviews.Author: katzenjams
Reviews.Content: Elegant, sophisticated, convenient Nob Hill location. Loved the full kitchen and beautiful decor. Convenient to great restaurants, coffee houses, grocer, laundry. If you need a reasonably priced long-term "home," you have found the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: Isnice
Reviews.Content: It REALLY saddens me to write this but I think that people should be armed with the facts before making the difficult choice of selecting a hotel. I chose this hotel on the back of the wonderful reviews it received. I absolutely agree...The Steinhart is truly a stunning hotel. The service was excellent and the room was amazing. I absolutely loved it - I cannot stress this enough. I wondered why this hotel was so cheap, upon my arrival, I found out why. The neighborhood is like a shantytown. I walked from the BART station to the hotel (a 5 minute walk) and I actually felt scared (I am usually not threatened in this situation at all). I was surrounded by at least 70 aggressive people on my short journey shouting and fighting on the streets. The roads emitted an overwhelmingly strong smell stale urine. It is EVERYWHERE and you cannot escape the stench, it literally took your breath away - I have never experienced anything like it. Every time I left the hotel I was in the same situation - people fighting and screaming and stale urine. I have noted that many reviewers of hotels state that their hotel was in a bad area, and I usually found this an unfair assessment. I have stayed at some of these hotels and whilst there was the occasional homeless person, it was really not that bad. As beautiful as this hotel was - it actually wrecked my SF experience - I left not wanting to ever come back to SF again. I wanted to just stay in my lovely hotel room - but for all the wrong reasons. Luckily I had to come back later in my trip (which I was dreading) and stayed at a hotel on Market street and my love for SF was reignited. Whilst I would recommend the hotel itself to everyone, it pains me to say that I cannot recommend it considering the area. I would hate for people to book this hotel without knowing the good and the bad in order to make an informed decision. I wish I had known. I would give the hotel itself 5 stars - I would give the whole experience less than one star. This hotel is really only suitable for people with a car.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tops100
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week and was wonderfull, the one bed rooms are big, really feels like an apartment you would live in, great guy on reception, position is close to everything and the area feels safe, i would recomend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great sorta-hotel-sorta-apartment. Many thanks to the GM Dimitar!”
Reviews.Author: aaronlynnme
Reviews.Content: I was in SF to take care of some business and some personal affairs, and was looking for somewhere to stay close to downtown and that would be in walking distance of shops and restaurants. Keeping in mind that I used to live in SF, so the general ghettoness of downtown SF didn't surprise me all that much - it's just part of the city, and isn't a reflection on the Steinhart at all. The Steinhart was great. I stayed in the studio-style room they had (with a Murphy bed) and it was very comfortable. Didn't really have any issues with street noise or anything, though there was some building going on on the same block so could hear some of that during the day. Any problems I had like the blinds not working Dimitar (the GM) had fixed almost immediately. The weekly room service was nice. You're also able to received UPS/FedEx packages directly there, which is a great bonus for getting business documents sent to you or for any impromptu online shopping you want to do. There is free wifi available hotel-wide for basic email/web-surfing but if you want to stream Hulu or do a lot of Skype calls, be prepared to pay $30 for the premium high-speed service. If you're a business traveller or you're going to be in town to take care of a bunch of personal errands, I'd highly recommend the Steinhart.

Reviews.Title: “Living almost like at home”
Reviews.Author: flying_fkb
Reviews.Content: The Steinhart Hotel might not give you typical hotel amenities like 24 front desk, a bar or restaurant but that is not the purpose of this hotel. It is meant for people who need place to stay longer than one week and who want a kitchen to once in a while cook their own meals. For this purpose it is the ideal place. Clean and unique rooms. A very friendly and helpful service at the front desk during the day. The possibility to receive mail. Grocery stores and a lot of restaurant and bars around the block. Only 20 minute to walk to the financial district. Washing machines and dryers in the basement or a laundry-mat place next door. I really enjoyed my stay at the Steinhart and would stay there again if I have a longer business trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good value charming apartments in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: XmasKid
Reviews.Content: The Steinhart Hotel is one of four in the Personality Hotels chain. We picked it mainly because it offers apartments, our preferred option when traveling these days especially with our two teenagers in tow for space and independence. We found Sutter St to be an eclectic neighbourhood populated by all cultures. The Academy of Art University has a residence nearby so there are quite a few students and artistic oriented types mulling around. The Lower Nob Hill address is really an in-between kind of street some walking blocks from Nob Hill, a wealthy district and Union Square, the shopping mecca. The surrounding area has no real attraction but is littered with "mom and pop" type restaurants, small businesses and several hotels. People are friendly and you get the sense of "living amongst the locals". There is a drop off laundry, Sutter Cleaners across the road providing good efficient service and a wonderful Gelato shop five doors down. Food is defiantly not a problem with a huge range of restaurants and eateries, grocery shops and a deli around the hotel vicinity. The neighbourhood is quiet at night. The hotel itself is housed in a historical building, the residence of Mr Steinhart who donated the Steinhart Museum to the city of San Francisco. The architecture is wonderful and it transports you back to the early 1900s. Our apartment was on the third floor overlooking the back courtyard. It was huge with separate bedroom, adequate functioning kitchen, dining and living areas as well as lots of closet space. The kids slept on rollaways in the living room which closes off for privacy. The only unfortunate thing was that the rooms did not receive a lot of natural lighting and were dark, so lights had to be on all the time. The neighbours are really close so blinds need to be down for privacy but it looked like all the apartments shared a similar fate. The lighting inside was adequate but brighter bulbs would have been appreciated. It became home in San Francisco very quickly for us. The Hotel front desk is manned from 9 am to 5 pm by a resident manager. He was welcoming and helpful but sometimes hard to find, probably due to being the only person responsible for the hotel. The is no concierge as well. Apartments are cleaned once a week, and the is a laundry downstairs (make sure you have coins and laundry powder). Don't forget the door pass codes especially after hours or you might be waiting a long time for someone to come by to let you in. There are no business facilities but there is free wifi in the rooms. Just beware that the fax machine does not work and there is no access to printers when the hotel manager is not around. Would we return? Depends on what we need. Yes for longer stays and no for shorter visits or on business. The Steinhart is not at the centre of action but it has charm. The Steinhart Hotel is one of four in the Personality Hotels chain. Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service and good rates.”
Reviews.Author: P0lako
Reviews.Content: A great experience. The hotel is amazing. Very special thanks to Dimitar, the hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “Value in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cityperks
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying here with my husband and nine month old baby. A lovely secure character apartment kept neat and clean with great front of house staff. Only ten minute walk to Union Square. $35 cab ride from international airport. $10 cab ride to Fisherman's Wharf. Also a bus stop out front. Comfy bed and plenty of space for all our shopping and baby paraphenalia. Older style kitchen that was well equipped. Apartment is cleaned once a week, but not replenished with toilet paper/soap. Heating worked well. Crib was ready in our room upon arrival. Hair dryer delivered to room upon request. Basement contained a washer/dryer...there is also a laundrette next door to apartment block. There is a large supermarket one block away. Street noise can be heard, but was not enough to keep us awake. Free wifi available. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grat value and location”
Reviews.Author: woodsie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week over New Year 2010/2011 and as a family of 5 Steinhart was great value in a great location. Room was big enough for 5 of us with rollaway included. This is not a hotel with concierge but front desk (attended 9 to 5) was very helpful. Who needs a concierge with TripAdvisor on your Ipad.

Reviews.Title: “Steinhart was more than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Dempsey76
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our recent stay at the Steinhart. Not only are the apartments perfectly decorated it also gave us lots of space for our week long stay at a much cheaper rate than just a plain hotel room. I was traveling with my 5 mos old daughter from New Zealand and meeting up with my parents from Colorado. When we began to consider being cooped up in two hotel rooms without a kitchen or common space (at San Fran prices) I researched and found the Steinhart online. I was not disappointed but rather it exceeded our expectations. We all joked that we would love to rent this apartment if we moved to the city. A very unique and large space. I was also conducting some work while we were there and the free wi-fi was an added plus. I get so sick of every hotel having ad-on pricing for everything. While it is not a full service hotel, Dimitar the property manager was either at the hotel or just a phone call away and was still able to provide all the concierge services we would expect at hotel including calling for a cab, getting us an extra hair dryer and any other needs we had. He was very professional and available The location is also good with grocery stores, cafes and shops very close and a 10 min walk to Union Square. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect building and team”
Reviews.Author: faouzi40
Reviews.Content: Amazing building near from downtown and buses with appartments looking like friends received you during holidays ! And a very special notice for Dimitar Stanev, the hotel manager, who helped us from the very begining until after we leaved ! My son forgot his fireman cap in the cab at the airport and Dimitar organized all for my son to receive it in France. THANK YOU AGAIN ! Definitely recommanded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickP1709
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean but only serviced once a week. More of an appartment than a hotel. You need to stock up on all consumables throughout your stay. Front desk was always willing to assit where possible and provided us with some items (toilet paper) when we unexpectedly ran out. Building entry is also secured with 2 security doors. Free onsite Wi-fi was like dial-up speed with the option for you to pay a fee to get the faster internet access. Quiet and safe location and walking distance (10mins) to Market St and also Trolley cars / trams to take you around town. There are also two convenient stores located on the same block. Restaurants and bars are also walking distance (5-10 mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Spacious and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Screen001Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Steinhart hotel for a week in September, 2010. The front desk staff was very welcoming, soft and very helpful. Rooms were clean and neat. Very spacious. Not much of noise. I would recommend staying here. If I go to San Francisco again, this would be my first choice of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl1981
Reviews.Content: I don't often say that about a hotel but I mean it. it was clean, the staff was helpful and the location was perfect for both walking and public transit to all of our destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleTree117
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor reviews, I initially booked a studio apartment for my 19 year old daughter and myself, amazed that I could get such a good deal in San Francisco. Later, because her friend decided to join us, I changed the booking to a one bedroom apartment. The hotel looked fantastic and full of character in photographs, but I was puzzled about two things: the low number of reviews and one review noting concerns about security. I can only think that the number of reviews reflects the fact that most people stay in San Francisco for shorter periods than the 7 nights required at the Steinhart, because this is an exceptional find. I value security highly, but this was also not a problem. As other reviews have noted, staying at the Steinhart is like having your own clean and stylish San Francisco apartment, and while the front desk is not always attended, there is a phone number for contact and two levels of security at the hotel entrance, so this is absolutely not a problem. The Steinhart blew us away. We loved the old lift, the collection of books and sitting area on the 1st floor, and the interior decorating. The apartment was incredibly spacious, with sliding doors between bedroom, lounge and dining area so you could reconfigure the space. It also had heaps of storage, a fully equipped kitchen (with dishwasher) and extremely comfortable beds. There's a tv in the bedroom and in the lounge. The dining area was nice and sunny. Just one thing about this, and all the other US hotels we stayed in - only a coffee maker is supplied. While at some other hotels this caught me out, at the Steinhart you at least have a microwave, coffee maker or stove if you want a cup of tea. There are laundry facilities in the hotel basement as well as a laundromat literally next door. What's more, there's no need to stock up on food because there are two convenience stores just a few doors away, a pizza shop, a gelataria and a great cafe. In fact, this area of Sutter Street is full of shops, and it's just a quick walk to Union Square, China Town is around the corner and it's also within walking distance of Fishermans Wharf. This level of convenience has one downside and that's a bit of noise from traffic. While we're used to complete silence at home, we didn't find this problematic. The staff at this hotel couldn't have been more efficient or friendly. They were quick to respond to all my initial email enquiries. They sent a reminder notification about my booking, and a follow up email after I had left. I can't recommend the Steinhart highly enough and we would definitely stay here again on future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Steinhart”
Reviews.Author: MikeAtkinson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Steinhart for a week in early March. I was traveling with my elderly mother and adult daughter, so wanted plenty of space with separate sleeping areas. At the last minute it turned out that the suite I had booked was unavailable. Manager Peter very kindly accomodated us by giving us another suite plus an adjacent unit for no extra charge. We were very impressed with the beautifully restored old heritage building, the spacious and well-equipped rooms, the gorgeous old elevator, the quiet building (other than some occasional noise from the street I didn't hear a sound from within the building), and the excellent attitude of the staff. The Steinhart is located on the edge of the Tenderloin, but we felt perfectly safe in the neighborhood. It is less than a 10 minute walk from Union Square, 3 short blocks to the California Street cable car, and buses less than a block away. We will stay at the Steinhart when we return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: Sarah027
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Steinhart. We spent a week in SF with our 2 children (8 & 10). Apartment was gorgeous with a fully equipped kitchen and very spacious (even with the bed down in the sitting room). Beds and bathrooms were clean and comfortable. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Peter, the manager, was also excellent and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful haven...”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethNZ_9
Reviews.Content: As a solo female traveller I found The Steinhart provided the ideal safe, comfortable and affordable accommodation. The heritage building with its modern conveniences is centrally located, and the staff did everything possible to make my stay enjoyable. My studio apartment was clean and quiet, with a separate well set-up kitchen - including a dishwasher! Wireless internet was available in the apartment, but having travelled without my laptop I was pleased to find I could access the internet at the Hotel Vertigo next door. Anyone wanting a pleasant and reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco should choose The Steinhart.

Reviews.Title: “The Steinhart is a hotel with a HEART”
Reviews.Author: BENDBABE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels, all over the world. I've stayed at Ritz Carltons and Four Seasons....but I've never stayed at a hotel that cared as much as this one. My husband and I came to San Francisco with little preparation for a very sudden, very scary operation. I had to have a place to bring him when he got out of the hospital and it had to be comfortable and homey for his recovery. I also had to have a kitchen. I first tried another popular long term hotel and found it to be shabby and worn. We were so delighted when we checked into the Steinhart. While it is an old hotel...it is really beautiful....Lovely woods and fixtures....great old cage elevator and updated rooms with comfortable beds, flat screen TV's and a full kitchen. We had a room with a livingroom (Murphy bed TV, small dining table, sofa, chairs, etc.), large bedroom (with the flat screen, DVD +++) a kitchen with stove, microwave, diswasher, refrigerator, all dishware and cooking utensils, pots and pans. The manager, Peter Friedman is a saint. He has been so good to us. He's helped us in countless ways and always with a smile and compassion. He assisted me in long term parking for the car, transferring luggage back and forth to the hospital and extended many other little kindnesses and comforts for us. We stayed there before the surgery and are about to return tomorrow for two weeks of recovery. I can't say enough for the way the staff (at the Vertigo next door who takes care of staffing this hotel) jumps to solve any problem... This is the perfect place for a long term stay in San Francisco....A short walk to Union Square on a street loaded with little sandwich shops, coffee places, small markets (two blocks to a big one) and even gelato and pizza next door. Two doors away is a great sandwich shop with fresh roasted chickens every day. I felt like I lived in the neighborhood after just a few days. And did I mention, a laundry in the basement! Do not hesitate to stay in this lovely little hotel....it is just so charming. I am not the only one who thinks so......as I was checking in a young Brit was checking out and fervently thanked Peter over and over for his many acts of kindness. I think you'll love it here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, apartment, attitude”
Reviews.Author: witless
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Steinhart for a total of 17 nights during the summer (June/July). Everything was really nice. The place was spotless, beds were comfortable, and the kitchen was decent. We had a few extra requests (baby cot, extra bed, etc) and these were attended to without any fuss or extra charge. There is basic (slowish) wireless internet access for free, though we paid for an upgraded connection as it didn't cost much ($20 for 7 days) - cheaper than usual hotel rates. The place has loads of character and a nice atmosphere. We felt the area to be very safe, with lots of fairly decent restaurants and bars around, and none of us had any concerns walking to or from Union Square day or night. It is a few blocks north of the edge of the Tenderloin, but a few blocks makes a big difference in San Francisco. It's more in the Nob Hill area really, without too much of the hill (an important factor with a 6-month old baby in a stroller) - actually just a gentle incline up Sutter Street from Union Square. We couldn't really find any faults. We rented a car a couple of times and overnight street parking is tricky, but possible with a bit of looking around, and certainly not the worst in San Francisco. Of course you can also pay for overnight parking in various lots. We had to carry the baby stroller up some steps at the front door, but that wasn't a major issue, and there is an elevator after that. And hats off to Peter (manager) for his courtesy and good attitude in general. Will definitely stay there when in SF again.

Reviews.Title: “A really good value”
Reviews.Author: MaxfromBerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Steinhart for one week. Arriving lately, we checked in at the sister hotel without any problems. The first night though was a little problem as we were two people not knowing that the murphy bed (nightly price 72 USD - a great value for SF!!!) is not really suitable for two. Besides I think the bed had a defect making a lot of noise by just moving a little or turning around. Peter, the manager promised to take care of it. So, in the next morning we asked for another room and got room 403, a two-bedroom appartment. Actually more than 100 bucks, we got it for just 10 USD more than the normal price! And it was very quite as going to the backyard. It smelled a little but by airing that went away. We had 2 big rooms, in the living room there was even another murphy bed. The kitchen was fully equipped (we just bought bigger plastic glasses as the ones there were quite small) and the enough space for a lot of clothes and stuff available. The bed was soooo comfortable. My boyfriend, a smoker, could go to the tiny backyard for smoking. So, we felt very at ease there... The place has got an amazing atmosphere! The place is amazing, the Union Square with all the shopping amenities just a short walk away, diners for breakfast or snack just around the corner. Peter, the manager, is an angel, we always knew where to go for problems. Even when we forgot our toiletry bag in the bathroom it was sent to us without any problems. Even a supposed forgotten perfume was refunded (as not found in our room), but to our shame we found it at home... So perfect service! So, we'd always come back even for a longer time as the apartments are really suitable for a longer stay as well as for the short one.

Reviews.Title: “Anything Ilegal you need is here.”
Reviews.Author: Toolman99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the No tell hotel Sept 3-9, 2009 and it was a scary place. My room was filthy dirty with mold in the shower. I had to go out and buy cleaning supplies since they only do housekeeping once a week. The staff at the Hotel Vertigo (thats who checks you in & out) were very rude and unprofessional. The hotel is a complete waste of time. There is ZERO security, if the front or back door are left open, the junkies can stumble in to crash on the couches. BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and good Location”
Reviews.Author: walker55Victoria
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. My 17 yr old son and I spent 6 nights at the Steinhart Hotel recently and loved it. It has no one on the desk during the week which to us , made it a little more private , like going to our own apartment ! Peter , the manager was great. We had a problem with our phone. My daughter could not call us. I talked to Peter who came right up and we found that the ringer was shut off ! He was prompt and professional and very pleasant. It was nice to know that he lived in the building too. The hotel was only 5-6 blocks from the main up-scale shopping area and very close to a large grocery store , the trolley system and we could walk just about anywhere. We had pizza from the Bellissimo right next door and it was great pizza and the man that runs it was one of the nicest people we encountered in San Francisco...very polite. The apartment was roomy , clean , had a great shower and was quiet for the most part. It was very comfortable and we got a great rate on the internet ... $700 ... for 7 nights ... you must book for a week at least ... and it allowed us to each have our own bed and our own space . I feel lucky to have found it . S Munro

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: raf89
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to be able to spend some time in SF - being an apartment hotel, the Steinhart requieres a stay of at least 7 nights - the Steinhart is a great choice. Beautiful building and great location, close to bus routes, restaurants and supermarkets (in case you decide to use your own kitchen). Some reviewers complained because there's no one at the reception most of the day, but it wasn't a problem for us: we felt perfectly safe and Peter - the manager - was always available (and extremely kind) every time we needed advice or help.

Reviews.Title: “The Steinhart exceeded all of our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: leasler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay in the fabulous city of San Francisco at the Steinhart. I was there for a family vacation - family of four with 8 & 16 year old children. The location of the Steinhart was perfect. It's right on the bus line and just a few blocks from the trolley line and Union Square. Within a block of the front door are coffee shops, pizza-by-the-slice, gelato, burritos, and a great little pub. We also walked to a Colibri Mexican Bistro and out of this world sushi at Sanraku. The management and the staff at the hotel were first rate. They helped us with computer issues, reservations for Alcatraz, and had terrific suggestions for interesting, off-the-beaten-path outings in the bay area. The accommodations were spacious and very comfortable. The hotel is a restored historic beauty that includes gorgeous common spaces. My children loved the original elevator - its elegance and uniqueness added to the week's experience. The room had a private master bedroom and plenty of room for the four of us to spread out and relax at the end of a day of sight-seeing. Also included: a full kitchen, huge closets, roomy bath, two flat screen TVs, murphy bed, and lovely floor-to-ceiling windows with a view of the bustling street below. It was such a hit that we are already planning our next visit to SF - at the Steinhart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: quinn23
Reviews.Content: On my last visit to San Francisco , I had arranged to stay at the Steinhart, a hotel I had not been familiar with. The Steinhart Hotel exceeded all expectations for my stay. Furnished with all the ammenities of home and a friendly, informative staff I could not have had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Steinhart was great!”
Reviews.Author: jimphish
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 8 days in San Francisco in April 2008 for his belated 21st birthday and our stay at the Steinhart helped make the trip great. We were in room 402 and had plenty of room to spread out and not get in each others way. I had my own room and in the evening the living room tranformed into his room by pulling a murphy bed down out of the wall. The full kitchen and lay out of the apartment enhanced our entire San Francisco experience. Hotel managment were friendly, attentive and helpful. San Francisco is always a wonderful place to be and the location of the hotel allowed us to walk to many places and the neighborhood it self was enjoyable. I would recommend the Steinhart to anyone spending more than a week in the San Francisco area.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with stay in Steinhart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank_se
Reviews.Content: In April 2007 we stayed 1 month at the Steinhart hotel. On arrival, after a long flight from Brussels-Amsterdam-San Francisco, we were welcomed by the friendly manager. We stayed at apartment 402 and were very pleased with the service. The streetnoise in the morning woke us up, but after two days we got accustumed to it. The charm of the hotel is its old-fashioned but wel maintained interior and the nice decoration of the apartment . During our stay we visited and explored San Francisco completely. With our month-ticket we could ride all bus or tramways and visit every corner of San Fransisco. The hotel was an ideal startpoint, far enough from Union Square and at the same time close enough to visit the entire city. To the financial district, China town, Market street, Embarcadero, Fishermans Wharf, Castro,... it was als the way walking dawnhill. To come back to the Steinhart we had the bus or tramway . We see the Steinhart as the ideal hotel for a longer stay, the accomodation and the location are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as short-term sublet alternative”
Reviews.Author: frigout
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel of choice for those looking for a stay between one and three months in S. Francisco. You will have difficulty finding a sublet for the same amount and services the Steinhart provides. Laundry and weekly housekeeping, including a fresh set of towels, are included in the rate. This is a residential hotel with a very small staff, but attentive and corteous. It feels more like an apartment building than a hotel. On the downside, expensive wireless internet access ($75/month), and no front desk staff after 5PM; after hours you need to go through two security code-enabled doors to enter the building. The architecture is extraordinary, but I would agree that the atmosphere would be improved by a more meticulous upkeep. My room (studio efficiency) had been renovated and was well-equipped with all kitchen appliances, dishware and utensils. The living room/bedroom had blackout curtains and a comfortable murphy bed that took up pretty much the entire space. New cordless phone, CD player/radio/alarm clock, cable TV and message board. Heating was only available in the bathroom: its fan was a little noisy and not potent enough to warm up the entire apartment. Prefer the apartments in the back, with numbers ending in 8 or 9, which get virtually no street noise. Overall, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was put up here after I showed up for my reservation at Kensington Park only to find the Kensington was over-booked. Their "sister" property, The Steinhart, looks okay but beware. The security is laughable, i.e., non-existent. When I complained about the comings and goings in the room next to mine, the front desk assured me there was nobody in the room! In fact, the hotel also has longterm apartment rentals and little control over the tenant-occupants who carry on with impunity. I wouldn't stay here, or in any of the Personality hotels again if my life depended on it.
